com.atakmap.android.hierarchy

Interface HierarchyListStateListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ModelFileHierarchyListItem, RouteListModel, VideoBrowserMapOverlay.ListModel

    public interface HierarchyListStateListener
    List navigation events within Overlay manager The HierarchyListItem sub-class must implement this interface to use Due to this requirement, methods can assume the list in question is 'this' Several of these events may be handled/suppressed by returning 'true' For more general Overlay Manager events see HierarchyStateListener

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean onBackButton(HierarchyListAdapter adapter, boolean deviceBack)
      A back button was pressed while on the list Event can be suppressed
      default boolean onCloseList(HierarchyListAdapter adapter, boolean forceClose)
      The list is about to be closed (popped off the stack or pushed beneath) Event can be suppressed unless forceClose is true
      default void onListVisible(HierarchyListAdapter adapter, boolean visible)
      The list's on-screen visibility state has changed Tied to DropDown.OnStateListener#onDropDownVisible(boolean) Not directly affected by list open or close events Event cannot be suppressed
      default boolean onOpenList(HierarchyListAdapter adapter)
      The list is about to be opened (pushed to the front of the stack) Event can be suppressed (i.e.

    • Method Detail

      • onOpenList

        default boolean onOpenList(HierarchyListAdapter adapter)
        The list is about to be opened (pushed to the front of the stack) Event can be suppressed (i.e. user cannot open the list)
        Parameters:
        adapter - Overlay Manager adapter
        Returns:
        True if event handled, false to allow the list to open normally

      • onCloseList

        default boolean onCloseList(HierarchyListAdapter adapter,
                            boolean forceClose)
        The list is about to be closed (popped off the stack or pushed beneath) Event can be suppressed unless forceClose is true
        Parameters:
        adapter - Overlay Manager adapter
        forceClose - True if the list is being forcibly closed
        Returns:
        True if event handled, false to allow the list to close normally

      • onListVisible

        default void onListVisible(HierarchyListAdapter adapter,
                           boolean visible)
        The list's on-screen visibility state has changed Tied to DropDown.OnStateListener#onDropDownVisible(boolean) Not directly affected by list open or close events Event cannot be suppressed
        Parameters:
        adapter - Overlay Manager adapter
        visible - True if the drop-down is visible

      • onBackButton

        default boolean onBackButton(HierarchyListAdapter adapter,
                             boolean deviceBack)
        A back button was pressed while on the list Event can be suppressed
        Parameters:
        adapter - Overlay Manager adapter
        deviceBack - True if the device back button was pressed False if the list's inline back button was pressed
        Returns:
        True if event handled, false for default back button behavior
